courses.customDesc: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D2, D2, Upper-Division D, E, and GE Electives (8). Upper-Division B, Upper-Division C, and Upper-Division D should be taken only after junior standing is reached (90 units). No POLS class may be taken to fulfill Upper-Division D. Refer to online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP) and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: Upper-Division B, C1, Upper-Division C, D1, Upper-Division D, or E.

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D2, D2, Upper-Division D, E, and GE Electives (8). Upper-Division B, Upper-Division C, and Upper-Division D should be taken only after junior standing is reached (90 units). No POLS class may be taken to fulfill Upper-Division D. Refer to online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP) and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: Upper-Division B, C1, Upper-Division C, D1, Upper-Division D, or E.
Select one course from the following: ANT201; GEOG150; HIST110, HIST111, HIST222, HIST223; SOC110.

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D2, D2, Upper-Division D, E, and GE Electives (8). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: Upper-Division B, C1, Upper-Division C, D1, Upper-Division D, or E.

Any POLS Major Course (300-400 level elective) can go here. A total of 4 units of either POLS386 or POLS387 may count toward upper division Political Science electives. A total of 4 units of either POLS386 or POLS387 may count towards the concentration. A total of 4 units of either POLS386 or POLS387 may count toward Free Electives. Any combination of POLS386 and POLS387 may be taken for a maximum of 12 units total credit for the degree.
select one course from the following: Any 200- or 300- level ES or WGS course.

Individualized Course of Study. A minimum of 28 units of coursework are selected by the student and approved by the student's academic advisor. 20 of these must be at least 300-400 level and 16 units must carry a POLS prefix.
